content:
Following up from the seeming lack of volunteers for crater triage for this cycle, I wanted to inquire with folks on the release team on several questions:

  • Are folks generally able/interested, but need forewarning? (e.g., is a rotation helpful for making sure we have someone?)
  • If not, is this due to lack of time in general or some particular attribute of this task? What can we do to make it possible for those currently on release to participate?

cc @T-release
Rotation and forewarning would be extremely helpful, IMO
ideally there would be a "secondary" who's more experienced, in case the primary needs help

One impediment is that sometimes I don't know what I'm signing up for, since I've never done it before. In my head it's a potentially unbounded use of my time that I may not have all the requisite skills for, which makes me hesitant to volunteer, which is also unfair.
to summarize: I want to help, I want there to be fairness, and I want to know I'll have support if I need it
for me it's mostly that I have a huge pile of things to do around the project and I need to prioritize :(
I would have had time if if were ok to wait for the weekend. I don't know if that was a hard deadline or you just thought no one would step up because I hadn't said anything.
That no one said anything; I wanted it over with since I wasn't sure I'd find energy on the weekend.
I don't have any capacity for additional work at the moment myself.
